messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:35): anyone have any opinions on what i should include in a section teaching people about form controls?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (02:40): graphics of shiny new UIs :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:41): well that'll be up to volunteers to provide :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:41): i suck at making pictures
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:41): everyone is welcome to contribute images though
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (02:43): is this section in addition to what's in http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/forms.html#forms?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:43): yeah i'm adding an intro section after that first paragraph
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (02:45): hmm, not really sure. but i've got a test page that could possible be added, or repurposed
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (02:45): http://www 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b.com/code/input-type-attr.html
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (02:46): s/added/linked to somewhere
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:47): i'm thinking more a tutorial-like thing
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (02:48): gotcha
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:48): When html5lib serializes to HTML, it includes a namespace declaration. (And uses the XHTML document's DOCTYPE, if any.) Is that intentional?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:51): hsivonen: i think i need an equivalent of #file and #line in the validator
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:53): hsivonen: i'm trying to validate the post-merge (but pre-anolis) file and the line numbers are very confusing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:54): 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b: here's what i have so far: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/complete.html#forms
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (02:57): hmm, i'm seeing the same thing as in the non-kitchen sink spec.
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (02:57): clears cache
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:57): there should be two new sections that say "This section is non-normative"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:57): at the top of the Forms section
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (02:59): ah yes, chromium is caching aggressively, apparently
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (03:02): mmm pizza
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (03:02): that looks good to me. with <label> is it worth d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920caioning the for='' attribute as well?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:02): maybe in due course
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:02): i'm trying to stay relatively simple
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:03): one could write a book about just this section
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (03:03): indeed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:03): what pizza toppings should we offer
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:03): so far i have bacon, extra cheese, and onion.
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (03:03): mushroom, por favor
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:03): mushroom it is.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:24): should i suggest the toppings be sent as topping=a&topping=b&topping=c, or toppingA=on&toppingB=on&toppingC=on?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:24): the former means explaining the value="" attribute on type=checkbox
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:24): the latter means explaining that it has a default
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (03:27): i think i prefer the first, but that's probably just an arbitrary personal preference
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (03:27): uh... but topping=a&topping=b would get parsed by webserver as topping=b ...?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:30): d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca: only if the webserver is buggy
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (03:32): how it should be passed to application then? like an array?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:32): that's up to the application
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:33): webservers that implement CGI just pass the data to the script unparsed
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (03:35): i understand html 5 doesn't cover this, i'm just curious about the standard behaviour of scripting languages
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:36): in perl, CGI.pm seems to offer it in a variety of forms, including an array form
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (03:36): PHP has a special behavior to handle it.  name="topping[]" makes it collect the values into a $_POST['topping'] array.
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (03:36): for example, let's say some binding parses those multiple key=val1&key=val2 as an array
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (03:36): Without the [] on the name, though, it just gives you the last one.
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (03:37): then key=a is is string, key=a&key=b is an array
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (03:37): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: that seems reasonable
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:44): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/complete.html#forms
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:44): now with more pizza

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:01): now with actual more pizza

7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (04:05): and not just because i'm hungry. i think.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:05): heh
